Hello,

/var/eppfiles/quicklogs 
It is far to big.
Please run
du -sh /var/eppfiles/quicklogs/* | grep G


Before changing the disk size in ssh, please be sure to create a VM snapshot to be able to return in case of issues.

To extend the storage, you need to run a few commands.
1. Stop all required services
service nginx stop
service cron stop
service mysql stop
service php-fpm stop
service rsyslog stop
pkill -f run_workers.php

If rsyslog is not present  try
service syslog-ng stop

2. Unmount the last partition
umount /dev/sda5

3. Edit master boot record
parted /dev/sda
p - this will print the partitions
resizepart 5 100% – this will resize
quit

Run the command:
partprobe

4. Check the partitions for errors:
e2fsck –f /dev/sda5

5. Resize last partition
resize2fs /dev/sda5

6. Check they can be mounted successfully
mount -a
df -h

7. Restart the EPP Appliance:
reboot

8. Check the new size with the commands:
df -h

Before changing the disk size in ssh, please be sure to create a VM snapshot to be able to return in case of issues.

To extend the storage, you need to run a few commands.
1. Stop all required services
service nginx stop
service cron stop
service mysql stop
service php-fpm stop
service rsyslog stop
pkill -f run_workers.php

If rsyslog is not present  try
service syslog-ng stop

2. Unmount the last partition
umount /dev/sda5

3. Edit master boot record
parted /dev/sda
p - this will print the partitions
resizepart 5 100% – this will resize
quit

Run the command:
partprobe

4. Check the partitions for errors:
e2fsck –f /dev/sda5

5. Resize last partition
resize2fs /dev/sda5

6. Check they can be mounted successfully
mount -a
df -h

7. Restart the EPP Appliance:
reboot

8. Check the new size with the commands:
df -h

umount /dev/sda5

parted /dev/sda

resizepart 5 100% – this will resize
quit

partprobe

e2fsck –f /dev/sda5

resize2fs /dev/sda5

mount -a
df -h

7. Restart the EPP Appliance:
reboot

8. Check the new size with the commands:
df -h

/var/eppfiles/quicklogs

Before changing the disk size in ssh, please be sure to create a VM snapshot to be able to return in case of issues.

To extend the storage, you need to run a few commands.
1. Stop all required services
service nginx stop
service cron stop
service mysql stop
service php-fpm stop
service rsyslog stop
pkill -f run_workers.php

If rsyslog is not present  try
service syslog-ng stop

2. Unmount the last partition
umount /dev/sda5

3. Edit master boot record
parted /dev/sda
p - this will print the partitions
resizepart 5 100% – this will resize
quit

Run the command:
partprobe

4. Check the partitions for errors:
e2fsck –f /dev/sda5

5. Resize last partition
resize2fs /dev/sda5

6. Check they can be mounted successfully
mount -a
df -h

7. Restart the EPP Appliance:
reboot

8. Check the new size with the commands:
df -h
